data.title: Oklahoma State University Athletics
data.meta_description: Rashod Owens (10) WR - 2023 Texas Bowl MVP 2023 AP All-Bowl Team Enjoyed a breakout year in 2023 as an explosive playmaker and capped it by earning Texas Bow...
data.text:
2023 Texas Bowl MVP

2023 AP All-Bowl Team

Enjoyed a breakout year in 2023 as an explosive playmaker and capped it by earning Texas Bowl MVP honors ... A multi-sport athlete in high school who has played both receiver and tight end at Oklahoma State.

2023 (Junior): Had the biggest season of his career so far, recording 63 catches for 895 yards and five touchdowns, all of which were second on the team and the most of his career through 2023 ... His receptions total ranked fifth in the Big 12 and his receiving yards total was seventh ... Earned honorable mention All-Big 12 honors from the league’s head coaches for the first time in his career ... Became the first wide receiver in history to win Texas Bowl MVP honors as he made 10 receptions for a Texas Bowl-record 164 yards and two touchdowns in the win over Texas A&M ... That performance also earned him recognition on the AP All-Bowl Team ... Played in all 14 games and started the final 10 ... Had three 100-yard receiving games to lead the team and tie for the second-most in the Big 12 ... In addition to the Texas A&M game, his other 100-yard games came in the Bedlam win over Oklahoma (10 catches for 136 yards) and in the win over Kansas (nine catches for 112 yards) ... Also had a multiple-touchdown day in the Big 12 Championship game against Texas, recording four catches for 85 yards and two touchdowns ... His other score came on a 20-yard catch at Iowa State ... Recorded a career-long 45-yard catch in the win over Kansas State and a 40-yard catch in the win over Kansas ... Had nine catches that gained at least 30 yards to lead the team ranks among the top 25 in the FBS ... His 14 20-yard catches also led the team ... Named OSU’s offensive MVP for his game-changing performance against Oklahoma ... Served as a game captain against Cincinnati.

2022 (Sophomore): Played in 12 of OSU’s 13 games ... Started against Kansas State, Kansas and Oklahoma ... Played both receiver and Cowboy Back ... Finished the year with six catches for 85 yards ... Had a season-long catch of 41 yards in the Guaranteed Rate Bowl against Wisconsin ... Recorded three tackles on special teams.

2021 (Freshman): Played in 10 games and started five times ... Made 17 catches for 257 yards and a touchdown on the season ... His longest reception was a 32-yard touchdown that came just before halftime of OSU’s win over Baylor ... It was also OSU’s longest reception of the game ... His season receiving total was fourth highest on the team and his catch total was sixth ... Led the team with 25 yards after catch at Iowa State and 23 yards after the catch in the season opener ... Made at least one catch in seven of his 10 games played.

2020: Saw action in four games, making his debut at Kansas and playing in the final three against TCU, Baylor and Miami ... Made two catches for 19 yards in the win at Kansas, including a long reception of 15 yards.

High School: Played for coach Matt Carroll at Roosevelt … Led his team to a 9-2 record as a senior, rushing for nearly 1,500 yards with 23 rushing touchdowns …. Eclipsed 100 yards rushing in seven of the 10 games in which he played … Also added 210 receiving yards on 16 catches … Finished the season with 1,689 all-purpose yards to earn honors as the San Antonio Express News San Antonio Athlete of the Year … As a junior, he recorded 938 all-purpose yards, including 589 receiving yards and 324 rushing yards with 11 total touchdowns … Also a talented basketball player and track athlete who had the best high school triple jump in the state of Texas as a junior during the 2019 outdoor season … His jump of 49’ 10.75” also ranked No. 11 in the United States for the season … Rated as a three-star prospect by 247Sports and ESPN … Ranked by ESPN as the No. 253 overall prospect in the state of Texas ... Chose Oklahoma State over offers from Army, Kansas, Tulane, UTSA and others.
